section.p: The introduction of a tube into a hollow organ (as the trachea or intestine) to keep it open or restore its patency if obstructed

ol.li:
Contains exactly one [1..1] laryngoscopeType with data type Code
Contains a code Set that identifies the type of scope or laryngoscope blade used to facilitate endotracheal intubation.

Contains exactly one [1..1] id with data type Id
Unique identifier for the type of larynoscope used.

Contains zero or more [0..*] laryngoscope, where its type is Surgery Device
Indicates the type of scope or laryngoscope blade used to facilitate endotracheal intubation.

Contains zero or one [0..1] stylet, where its type is Surgery Device
Indicates the stylet that was used to shape the endotracheal tube during intubation.

Contains zero or one [0..1] endotrachealTube, where its type is Surgery Device
Indicates the endotracheal tube used during the major portion of the procedure.

Contains zero or one [0..1] biteBlock, where its type is Surgery Device
Indicates whether a bite block is used to protect the endotracheal tube

Contains zero or one [0..1] trauma, where its type is Intubation Trauma
A fine wire that is run through a catheter, cannula, or hollow needle to keep it stiff or clear of debris.

Contains exactly one [1..1] value, where its type is Intubation Evaluation
An assigned or calculated numerical quantity

Contains exactly one [1..1] laryngoscopeType with data type Code
Contains a code Set that identifies the type of scope or laryngoscope blade used to facilitate endotracheal intubation.

Contains exactly one [1..1] id with data type Id
Unique identifier for the type of larynoscope used.

Contains zero or more [0..*] laryngoscope, where its type is Surgery Device
Indicates the type of scope or laryngoscope blade used to facilitate endotracheal intubation.

Contains zero or one [0..1] stylet, where its type is Surgery Device
Indicates the stylet that was used to shape the endotracheal tube during intubation.

Contains zero or one [0..1] endotrachealTube, where its type is Surgery Device
Indicates the endotracheal tube used during the major portion of the procedure.

Contains zero or one [0..1] biteBlock, where its type is Surgery Device
Indicates whether a bite block is used to protect the endotracheal tube

Contains zero or one [0..1] trauma, where its type is Intubation Trauma
A fine wire that is run through a catheter, cannula, or hollow needle to keep it stiff or clear of debris.

Contains exactly one [1..1] value, where its type is Intubation Evaluation
An assigned or calculated numerical quantity
